810412948638953.title: Sensor Modeling Engineer
810412948638953.location: Sunnyvale, CA • Burlingame, CA • Full Time
810412948638953.responsibilities: Collaborate closely with cross functional teams and external partners to push the boundaries of technologies and deliver best-in-class hardware solutions Lead efforts to integrate new technologies into high volume consumer products through all stages of product development (from prototyping, design through mass production) Generate analytical models of subsystems and validate them through design of experiments and lab testing Perform static, dynamic, structural and thermal-mechanical analyses to guide design optimization before hardware prototyping Collaborate with vendor resources to leverage their engineers and maximize the focus of internal resources on adding value to and differentiating our product
810412948638953.minimum_qualifications: BS in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or practical equivalent work experience 8+ years of relevant industry experience or similar Expertise in advanced technologies, including consumer electronics products Experience leading technical teams, cross-functional groups and vendors
810412948638953.preferred_qualifications: Masters or PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or practical equivalent work experience 8+ years of relevant industry experience with focus on sensor technologies Experience leading efforts to integrate new sensor modalities into high volume consumer products Experience in advanced FEA for capacitive touch, proximity sensing technologies, preferably in consumer electronics products as well as worked in structural and electrostatic analysis with non-linear FEA/FEM Proficient in Abaqus, ANSYS, COMSOL, or other FEA tools Proficient in human body modeling Experience defining sensor performance specifications for a product Experience performing bench level measurements coupled with analytical experience Experience with other sensing modalities such as optical, motion, acoustic/utrasonic and health sensing Experience with lab measurements and factory tests as needed to validate the model and run root-cause analyses Proficiency with data collection and analysis tools including JMP, Python, LabView, MATLAB and other scripting languages Experience communicating novel concepts to a broad audience succinctly and in simple terms
810412948638953.compensation: $170,000/year to $240,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta Experience in Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), statistical tolerance analysis techniques, functional dimensioning, GD&T, and 3D/2D CAD Working knowledge in material properties, such as plastics, metal, adhesive, and glass Testing and analysis experience (FEA, Simulation, Design of Experiments, etc.) Knowledge of high-volume manufacturing techniques (stamping, machining, 3D printing, injection molding, etc.) Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

meetings in partnership with administrative and business leads Provide policy and procedural guidance to executives and executive support staff concerning proper protocol requirements for internal and
